alternatives.transcript: Hi, I'm Jacques Pepin and I'm cooking at home. This is a very simple recipe for a main course. It's very easy to do, good. You can vary as much as you can. I call it a sausage papillote. A papillote, you know what we call a papillote, is a casing of paper. In that case, aluminum foil, you put food and you put it into the oven. So I have some kielbasa sausage here. I'm going to try to remove most of the skin here. And you can use all kind of different sausage that you can find at the market. In that case here, we have that kielbasa, which is cooked. It's a cooked sausage, but this 1 here is a raw Italian type of sausage. I have a large piece of aluminum foil here. Should be like 20 by 20. So I have 2 piece. This is for maybe 2, 4 people. I mean, if you want, I have 2 piece of sausage per person here. Now I have the potato, 2 potato. I have, well, 1 onion cut in half. Actually, that may be enough. I have like 5 or 6 clove of garlic, you know, a couple of carrot. Thing that I have in my refrigerator, you know, very often. Some mushroom there, they're a bit, a bit dark, but perfectly fine. And then for flavoring, I have fresh thyme here, some bay leaf. Oh, I'll put a dash of salt on top of this. Okay. Maybe a bit of Tabasco. And Some olive oil. Okay. Then you can of course prepare that way ahead and you will have to put it into the oven. It's gonna take probably close to an hour. So I fold it this way. Start with the corner here. And at the end here, where you have the opening here, you don't want to get it too tight. You don't want to get it too tight. You don't want to get it too tight to the meat inside. You want to have space between the meat and the thing for some steam to develop. Some steam and so that it cook with the steam. So here we go, we go all around. It's an easy thing to do for a party of 6, 8 or more. And that's it. I'm gonna put that in the oven, like 400 degree, close to an hour. We're back with the sausage in papillote now. Oop, It's hot. You open your papillote, you can serve it. I mean, I serve it like that at the table, you know? I mean, look at that. Ooh! It is hot. A little bit of herb on top. It's beautiful, I can see that the sausage are really cooked, the potato are really cooked too. Great meal to do in no time at all. I hope you'll enjoy it. Happy cooking. ♪♪♪ Thank you. Thank you.

paragraphs.transcript:
Hi, I'm Jacques Pepin and I'm cooking at home. This is a very simple recipe for a main course. It's very easy to do, good. You can vary as much as you can. I call it a sausage papillote.

A papillote, you know what we call a papillote, is a casing of paper. In that case, aluminum foil, you put food and you put it into the oven. So I have some kielbasa sausage here. I'm going to try to remove most of the skin here. And you can use all kind of different sausage that you can find at the market.

In that case here, we have that kielbasa, which is cooked. It's a cooked sausage, but this 1 here is a raw Italian type of sausage. I have a large piece of aluminum foil here. Should be like 20 by 20. So I have 2 piece.

This is for maybe 2, 4 people. I mean, if you want, I have 2 piece of sausage per person here. Now I have the potato, 2 potato. I have, well, 1 onion cut in half. Actually, that may be enough.

I have like 5 or 6 clove of garlic, you know, a couple of carrot. Thing that I have in my refrigerator, you know, very often. Some mushroom there, they're a bit, a bit dark, but perfectly fine. And then for flavoring, I have fresh thyme here, some bay leaf. Oh, I'll put a dash of salt on top of this.

Okay. Maybe a bit of Tabasco. And Some olive oil. Okay. Then you can of course prepare that way ahead and you will have to put it into the oven.

It's gonna take probably close to an hour. So I fold it this way. Start with the corner here. And at the end here, where you have the opening here, you don't want to get it too tight. You don't want to get it too tight.

You don't want to get it too tight to the meat inside. You want to have space between the meat and the thing for some steam to develop. Some steam and so that it cook with the steam. So here we go, we go all around. It's an easy thing to do for a party of 6, 8 or more.

And that's it. I'm gonna put that in the oven, like 400 degree, close to an hour. We're back with the sausage in papillote now. Oop, It's hot. You open your papillote, you can serve it.

I mean, I serve it like that at the table, you know? I mean, look at that. Ooh! It is hot. A little bit of herb on top.

It's beautiful, I can see that the sausage are really cooked, the potato are really cooked too. Great meal to do in no time at all. I hope you'll enjoy it. Happy cooking. ♪♪♪ Thank you.

Thank you.

sentences.text: Hi, I'm Jacques Pepin and I'm cooking at home.
This is a very simple recipe for a main course.
It's very easy to do, good.
You can vary as much as you can.
I call it a sausage papillote.
A papillote, you know what we call a papillote, is a casing of paper.
In that case, aluminum foil, you put food and you put it into the oven.
So I have some kielbasa sausage here.
I'm going to try to remove most of the skin here.
And you can use all kind of different sausage that you can find at the market.
In that case here, we have that kielbasa, which is cooked.
It's a cooked sausage, but this 1 here is a raw Italian type of sausage.
I have a large piece of aluminum foil here.
Should be like 20 by 20.
So I have 2 piece.
This is for maybe 2, 4 people.
I mean, if you want, I have 2 piece of sausage per person here.
Now I have the potato, 2 potato.
I have, well, 1 onion cut in half.
Actually, that may be enough.
I have like 5 or 6 clove of garlic, you know, a couple of carrot.
Thing that I have in my refrigerator, you know, very often.
Some mushroom there, they're a bit, a bit dark, but perfectly fine.
And then for flavoring, I have fresh thyme here, some bay leaf.
Oh, I'll put a dash of salt on top of this.
Okay.
Maybe a bit of Tabasco.
And Some olive oil.
Okay.
Then you can of course prepare that way ahead and you will have to put it into the oven.
It's gonna take probably close to an hour.
So I fold it this way.
Start with the corner here.
And at the end here, where you have the opening here, you don't want to get it too tight.
You don't want to get it too tight.
You don't want to get it too tight to the meat inside.
You want to have space between the meat and the thing for some steam to develop.
Some steam and so that it cook with the steam.
So here we go, we go all around.
It's an easy thing to do for a party of 6, 8 or more.
And that's it.
I'm gonna put that in the oven, like 400 degree, close to an hour.
We're back with the sausage in papillote now.
Oop, It's hot.
You open your papillote, you can serve it.
I mean, I serve it like that at the table, you know?
I mean, look at that.
Ooh!
It is hot.
A little bit of herb on top.
It's beautiful, I can see that the sausage are really cooked, the potato are really cooked too.
Great meal to do in no time at all.
I hope you'll enjoy it.
Happy cooking.
